summary: The Coast Guard and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) collectively spend billions of dollars to replace aging ships that conduct search and rescue, icebreaking, and research missions. We testified on how lessons learned from our extensive work on ship acquisitions could be used to inform how the Coast Guard and NOAA buy ships. These include: developing a long-term strategic plan establishing a sound business...
title: Coast Guard Acquisitions: Lessons Learned to Inform Coast Guard and NOAA Shipbuilding Efforts
